newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia says to drop purchase of U.S. jets.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia says to drop purchase of U.S. jets.

text.p: Foreign Minister Ali Alatas said on Friday Indonesia was withdrawing from a U.S. military training programme and was dropping its planned purchase of nine U.S. F-16 warplanes due to opposition in the U.S. Congress.
Alatas told a news conference Jakarta appreciated its relations with the administration of U.S. President Bill Clinton and was making these moves to avoid further friction.
The foreign minister said the decision was conveyed in a letter from President Suharto to Clinton dated May 26 but only sent on June 2 due to technical reasons.
He said Suharto hoped that the removal of frictions linked to Congressional criticism of Indonesia would allow the two countries to press ahead on important political, economic and security issues.
Alatas said the decision was not linked to criticism by the U.S. State Department of the conduct of Indonesia's general elections last week, in which the ruling Golkar won a sweeping victory.
